intro: Salicornia utahensis, commonly known as Utah glasswort, is a halophyte plant adapted to thrive in saline environments. It is characterized by its succulent, salt-tolerant stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. This plant typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other saline habitats across the western United States. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid and coastal regions. Utah glasswort is also valued for its nutritional content and use in culinary applications.
